In office
9 June 1983 – 30 March 2015

Dunfermline East
(1983–2005)
served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Labour Party from 2007 to 2010
Chancellor of the Exchequer from 1997 to 2007
Member of Parliament (MP) for Dunfermline East from 1983 to 2005
Kirkcaldy and Cowdenbeath from 2005 to 2015
served as United Nations Special Envoy for Global Education since 2012
appointed as World Health Organization Ambassador for Global Health Financing in 2021
appointed to Neil Kinnock's shadow cabinet in 1989
named Shadow Chancellor of the Exchequer by John Smith in 1992
Following Labour's victory in the 1997 general election, Brown was appointed as chancellor
